title: Christmas In The Stars: Star Wars Christmas Album
body: <blockquote><p><q>Pure crap</q> - <cite>Anthony Daniels (C3PO)</cite></p></blockquote><p>If it weren't for <a href="http://hype.non-standard.net/">The Hype Machine</a>, I'd have no idea that <a href="http://www.amazon.com/exec/obidos/ASIN/B0000033VG/dieselhome-20">this album</a> existed.  Featuring such tracks as "R2-D2 We Wish You A Merry Christmas" and "What Can You Get A Wookie For Christmas When He Already Has A Comb?", how could you go wrong? You can preview 2 full tracks <a href="http://ericnuzum.typepad.com/orangejellolemonjello/2006/11/the_christmas_f.html">at Orangejello Lemonjello</a>. Aside from the ridiculous gouging from the sellers on Amazon, it's available for just $1.22USD on <a href="http://www.gomusic.ru/album.aspx?id=16116">GoMusic.ru</a>, which I'm assuming is as <s>il</s>legal as <a href="http://music.allofmp3.com/r2/Various_-_Holiday___Christmas_Songs/Christmas_In_The_Stars_-_The_Star_Wars_Christmas_Album/group_9123/album_54/albref_14/mcatalog.shtml">AllOfMp3.com ($1.47USD)</a>.</p>
bodyArticleHtml:
2006-12-08

Christmas In The Stars: Star Wars Christmas Album

Pure crap - Anthony Daniels (C3PO)

If it weren't for

bodyNavItems.text: It HAS to be HACKER SAFE!
Christmas In The Stars: Star Wars Christmas Album
